org.cast.cwm.data
Class User

java.lang.Object
  org.cast.cwm.data.PersistedObject
      org.cast.cwm.data.User
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<User>, net.databinder.auth.data.DataUser
@Entity
public class User
extends PersistedObject
implements Serializable, net.databinder.auth.data.DataUser, Comparable<User>

A person who uses the application. Almost all persistent data in the application is, in some way, linked to a User account. Usernames must be unique across the application.

See Also:

Field Detail

subjectId

protected String subjectId

username

protected String username

role

protected Role role

periods

protected SortedSet<Period> periods

valid

protected boolean valid
A "valid" user can log in and generally use the features of the application. You may set valid to false if the user should be hidden in lists, prevented from logging in, etc. This is false by default. EditUserPanel, which should be used to create users has a setAutoConfirm method that will allow you to automatically create valid users.

firstName

protected String firstName

lastName

protected String lastName

email

protected String email

createDate

protected Date createDate
Record of when this user account was created.

securityToken

protected String securityToken
Used to store a token (generally a long random string) that can be used in lieu of or in addition to a password. This is for operations like registering via email or recovering a lost password.

usesPeriods

public boolean usesPeriods()
Should we expect this user to have connections to specific Periods? By default students, teachers, and researchers do, but apps may override this.
